definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: The bugle sounded as the troops advanced.
When he heard the bugle call, he caught up his gun and dashed out.
sentences.chinese: 他听到军号声时，抓起枪就冲出去了。

sentences.english: In the morning, when the bugle sounded from the barracks they rose and looked out of the window.
sentences.chinese: 早晨，从军营里传来军号声，他们起床望着窗外。

sentences.english: Another blare of trumpets signaled that the limousine carrying Brezhnev had entered the Southwest Gate.
sentences.chinese: 在又一阵军号声中，勃列日涅夫的小轿车进入西南门。

sentences.english: The bugle sounded and the assault jumped off.
sentences.chinese: 军号一响，突袭便开始了。

sentences.english: They stepped so high and they made the bugles ring.
sentences.chinese: 他们踩着高高的步伐并吹响了军号。

sentences.english: The pastor said the usual prayers and the bugler played taps.
sentences.chinese: 牧师按常规做了祷告，号手吹起了军号。

definition: soldier's copper saucepan, used for cooking food by day and for sounding the night watches during the hours of darkness (in ancient times)
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
to wail/to cry out in distress
